Portfolio                                                             Course Descriptions                                                                                                              Home / Academics / Master of Social Work                                                               Build Your Portfolio                                                                                                                                                                                 Through our impressive range of electives, one-credit intensives, focused-learning opportunities (FLOs) and field placements, students can focus on specific aspects of social work, including children and families; community- or hospital-based mental health; global social work, substance abuse; schools; health; disability; working with the older adults; social work and the law; and social work policy practice.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        Students can select from our rich and diverse offerings to build a focused portfolio suited to their professional interests.     Examples of our practice areas and related electives are provided below. One-credit intensives are noted with (O).   Please note: Not all electives are offered every semester. Refer to the course catalog in Albert each semester for a list of active courses.
